alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Carroll; Howard (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 7:44PM EDT until September 08 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL...NORTHEASTERN HOWARD AND WEST CENTRAL BALTIMORE COUNTIES... At 744 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ellicott City, or west of Historic Ellicott City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Pikesville, Ellicott City, Randallstown, Owings Mills, Eldersburg, Milford Mill, Lochearn, Sykesville, Oakland, Henryton, West Friendship, Woodstock, Gaither, Granite, Daniels, Glenelg, Marriottsville, and Carrolltowne. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
